articles.title: Scientists found out what's at the center of Earth's core. It's another core. - The Washington Post
articles.description: A pair of seismologists documented new evidence of a fifth layer: a 400-mile thick solid metallic ball at the center of Earth’s inner core — like the smallest figurine of a massive, planetary Russian nesting doll set.
articles.content:
